text: Joseph Richard 'Joe' Brennan (1908-1949) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s. ==Career== Brennan was the elder brother of Len Brennan who also played for St. George and was a schoolboy GPS sprint champion. Brennan played with the Saints for four seasons from 1931 to 1934.The TRUTH (Sydney) Joe Brennan Photo 7/8/1932 https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/169134092?searchTerm=%22joe%20brennan%22%20%22st.george%22&searchLimits;=l-state=New+South+Wales|||l-decade=193. He played one season with Souths in 1936 before retiring from rugby league. Alan Whiticker/Glen Hudson: Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players, 1995. ==Death== Brennan died from accidental tetanus poisoning in Griffith, New South Wales on 23 June 1949.The Sun (Sydney) 'Tetanus Death" https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/229775496?searchTerm=%22joseph%20brennan%22&searchLimits;=l-state=New+South+Wales|||l-decade=194|||l-year=1949 Sydney Morning Herald:Death Notice 24/6/1949 https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/18120371?searchTerm=joseph%20richard%20brennan&searchLimits;=l-state=New+South+Wales|||l-decade=194|||l-year=1949|||l-category=Family+Notices|||l-title=35 ==References== Category:St. George Dragons players Category:South Sydney Rabbitohs players Category:Rugby league wingers Category:Australian rugby league players Category:1908 births Category:1949 deaths
title: Joe Brennan (rugby league)
